ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And you pass by them in the daytime and at night.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: You pass by (their habitations) in the morning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: You pass by their desolate habitations in the morning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: You pass by (their ruined town) in the morning and at night.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And indeed you pass over them in the morning. –
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, you pass by them in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And most surely you pass by them in the morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and you pass by them in the morning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And lo! ye verily pass by (the ruin of) them in the morning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: You pass by their ruins morning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And surely ye pass by them in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed you pass by them at dawn
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily, ye pass by their (sites), by day-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, you pass by them in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: You pass by them in the morning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: You pass by them in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And indeed, you pass by them in the morning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:137] And indeed you pass by them, by their remains and [the remains of] their dwellings during your travels, [both] in the morning, that is, during the daytime,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And lo! Ye) people of Mecca (verily pass by (the ruin of) them) by the towns of Lot: Sodom, 'Amura, Sabura and Daduma (in the morning
